title: Universal Food Credits
desc:
Imagine if every single individual in the country received $40 / week to spend only on locally grown groceries.

I've calculated that below and it would cost ~$685 billion dollars. For some context the SNAP (ebt) program distributed ~$75 billion, providing ~40 million people with $150 / month for eligible food. (see footnotes below).

From reading the retail data, one problem I see is that so much of that money is spent on imported food. And only .05% at farmers markets.

If we could ensure the money spent stays circulating in the US, I would think we could get a lot closer to that $685 billion.

But this is not my area of expertise at all. I'm a developer and believe I can develop a food credits system for subsidizing locally grown food, especially in communities where their most common options are McDonalds and liquor stores.

So this is an invitation to share your insights, experience or ideas.
